FuncDef:
The value-added-service edsg accounting command enables a device to send a real-time accounting packet carrying the HW-Acct-Update-Address (26-159) attribute with a value of 1 for EDSG services when the user address changes.
The undo value-added-service edsg accounting command restores the default configuration.
By default, when the user address changes, a device does not send a real-time accounting packet carrying the HW-Acct-Update-Address (26-159) attribute with a value of 1 for EDSG services.
CLIs: value-added-service edsg accounting interim send-update user-ip enable
undo value-added-service edsg accounting interim send-update user-ip enable

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that a real-time accounting packet for EDSG services is sent when the user address changes.
-

Indicates that real-time accounting packets are sent for EDSG services.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-aaa] value-added-service edsg accounting interim send-update user-ip enable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
User address changes involve the following scenarios:
When a single-stack user changes to a dual-stack user, the user address changes to two addresses.When a dual-stack user changes to a single-stack user, the user addresses change to one address.
If a device is performing accounting on EDSG services during a user address change, the device must notify the accounting server of the change. To enable a device to send a real-time accounting packet carrying the HW-Acct-Update-Address (26-159) attribute with a value of 1 for EDSG services, run the value-added-service edsg accounting command.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
